item.title: Electric car using charging spot a personnel parking space, 20th September
item.description:
The vehicle wd25 rxc is continually using the electric vehicles only spot to park in (without charging) this is often for couple of days at a time. Residents and other EV users are unable to use this space while this is happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Preston Road, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste fly tipped, 20th September
item.description:
Many cardboard boxes and a few black sacks. Cardboard is obviously commercial waste as there a considerable amount of it. It's waste from bulk packaging of soft drinks, alcohol, crisp, snacks and sweets. Also beer cans beside the clothing banks. Please remove. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cooden Close, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty/smelly /overgrown pathway, 20th September
item.description:
This pathway is used constantly by the public , but mainly for parents taking their children to school. The pathway is always full overgrown stinging nettles. The main issue is that dog walkers do not pick up their dog mess down this path. Which is a health and safety issue. Children walk along this pathway to go in to school. It’s disgusting. There is only one dog bin right at the end of the pathway. Can the council regularly clean it. Put more dog bins along the path to encourage dog walkers to pick up their mess. And can signs be put up to enforce dog walkers to pick up their mess. My daughter has stepped in dog poo on her way into school before , it’s disgusting. And not nice for children to walk through when going into school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beck Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
